name: Elara, a Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel - Center Strip

reviews.text: After reading some former reviews, we were a little scared to go on our business trip and stay there. However, we had no problems whatsoever! We had a 1 bedroom attached to another 1 bedroom...each had it's own bathroom. The smaller suite had a kitchen sink, dishwasher, and microwave that also cooked as an oven. The larger suite had a full kitchen with dining table...very nice! Both suites were clean at check-in and were made-up very well each day of our stay. All staff we came into contact with was very nice. Noise at night was a little loud, but we're sure it's like that pretty much anywhere in Vegas with people coming and going at all times. We liked that it was attached to the Miracle Mall for easy shopping and dining. We liked Ocean One Bar and Grill for breakfast...reasonable prices and great food. Overall, we loved it...we had stayed at the Bellagio 2 years ago and we hated it....much better experience this time!!
reviews.title: Convenient and Clean!

reviews.text: I was hesitant to stay here given the decidedly mixed reviews, but I had a great experience. I just spent 2 nights here in a one-bedroom suite (upgraded from a junior suite). The room (well, the rooms) was enormous. Everything was clean and comfortable and in good working order. Elevators were fast and the room was relatively well sound-proof (apart from the many people who let their room doors slam shut behind them). The location is also excellent. Nice perks were a full-size coffee maker with coffee and a full refrigerator with an automatic ice/water dispenser on the front. Oh, and there were 4 TVs in the rooms -- excessive if you ask me, but some would probably like that.
reviews.title: Very impressive

reviews.text: The only negative was the lack of water flow and pressure from the shower. It was just a trickle and so it took me longer than usual to shower each morning. But that's a minor item in the scheme of things.
reviews.title: Great apartments, excellent location, service needs improving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked 7 days here for my family (husband, baby and my mother). The rooms are perfect for families (large living/kitchen area, microwave, full size fridge) however upon arrival was very disappointed with the lack of care the customer service representative showed upon check in. After travelling for 24 hrs, was bluntly told by the female staff member that check in was not until 4pm, and that we'd just have to wait 'over there' (waved us off in the general direction of the couches where 10 young, drunk, scantily clad people sat). The foyer was like a nightclub - and this was at 2pm.
reviews.title: Great location in Vegas strip!

reviews.text: After travelling for so long, being exhausted and dealing with an overtired, cranky 7 month old, I just would have appreciated some empathy, perhaps reassurance that our room could be organized as soon as possible, perhaps some water.... All little things that would have made a big difference. Instead we were shunned aside by a rude, apathetic staff member who could not have cared less.
reviews.title: Good rooms but details not up to Hilton standards, Party Central atmosphere

reviews.text: Liked:
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Free parking, Miracle Mile
reviews.title: OMG this is a Hilton?

reviews.text: Spacious suites
reviews.title: WOW Factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Central location
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Don't have to walk through a casino
reviews.title: Cool place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is beautiful and the junior suite looked awesome ,What a great view.But then came the problems like I tried to fill the large jetted tub but had to abort for two reasons, no water pressure, and no hot water,it was warm thou.But it did have a shower you could bend over and get under a-bit of water.Then to our surprise on our first day we recieved a letter stating the pool would be closed during our stay for a party ,what?How about some sort of a comp,you are taking away what I payed for, and amenities are a reason I chose this hotel.AS a matter of fact I cancelled the great Signature by MGM Thanks.....Oh and the pillows are like rocks....
reviews.title: Nice but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, it's important to note that we planned this trip from where we live in central Canada to Vegas, to celebrate my husband's birthday. We've stayed at the PH Towers Westgate before, and LOVED it - so when we were able to get a great deal a few months ago we excitedly booked there again. A few weeks prior to our trip, I noticed (while checking Tripadvisor reviews, ironically enough) that the hotel was now called Elara and that it was now a Hilton hotel. I phoned right away to ensure that nothing would change with our reservation - the person I spoke with assured me that it wouldn't, and that everything would be the same as it was when it was a Westgate property. It wasn't. Well, the building itself was exactly the same - the ONLY physical changes since it's become a Hilton is the exterior signage and the removal of the little 'PH Towers' pillows on the bed. Nothing has been overhauled - even though in many places it's necessary - and there are still several places where 'PH Towers' still exists i.e. the gift shop bags, the sign inside each room door.....Even though the pool was in fabulous shape, we weren't allowed to USE it because of a 'grand-opening celebration' (we're not exactly sure what there is to celebrate in a situation where a hotel hasn't been revamped or improved in any way). We found this out from a letter stuck in our door the morning after our arrival, instead of from an actual person when we checked in, which is incredibly poor customer service - and a really bad start for a company trying to keep previous customers after a take-over. We were told that we could use the Planet Hollywood pool instead, but if you're familiar with the strip you know that it's a bit of a trek (a 13-minute walk - we timed it) to get from PH Towers to the Planet Hollywood pool - a complete pain in the a$s if you already have a perfectly fabulous pool in your own hotel. Then, on the night of the grand-opening celebration, all of the hotel guests were deviated from the usual lobby route to another floor/other elevators if they wanted to get anywhere, which was also an imposition when you're on vacation and want things to be smooth and relaxing. One other interesting piece is that when we checked in, the front desk employee took the $20 I gave him for an upgrade, yet didn't upgrade us. We had the same room we had booked in the first place! (so why didn't he just tell me that he couldn't help us out, and let me keep the $20?) WE WILL NEVER STAY AT ELARA AGAIN. All of that being said, the elevator staff was fantastic - you honestly couldn't ask for nicer or more professional people - and our housekeeping staff was great as well.
reviews.title: Wow what a disappointment.

reviews.text: My husband, sister, her husband and I stayed at the Elara this past week. We had a beautiful room and views. The room service was not great, but we were fine and when we called they were very quick and responsive. But on Thursday of our stay as we returned to our room after breakfast, we realized that the Hilton executives were going to celebrate purchasing the hotel. To our dismay, the pool was closed, we were escorted thru a side door and side elevators to our room. We found this to be very demeaning to the people on vacation. We were leaving Las Vegas last night and had planned to sit at the pool in the early afternoon. We were told that we should have received a notice about the "party for the executives" which we did not. In talking with other people, they did not receive any notice either. I think the executives should have used the side elevators and the pool should have remained open for everyone. By celebrating the purchase, who better to celebrate with then the people who are on vacation and paying to stay at their hotel. Although the place was very nice, we will not be visiting any Hilton's anytime soon.
reviews.title: Hotel room was nice but other problems...

reviews.text: Check in was a breeze, no queues and with a smile and a twenty dollar tip we were upgraded to a strip view on the 54th floor in a 1 bedroom suite. (from 21st floor).
reviews.title: Perfect for an off strip stay yet near enough to the hustle and bustle when you decide to get back into the action!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Access to the hotel is either off Harmon (main entrance & taxi drop off) or through the Miracle Mile Shops, a 2 minute trek past the pool, so it's technically off strip! But in just 5 minutes you're in the heart of Planet Hollywood!
reviews.title: Don't believe the negative people

reviews.text: We are owners. Are we stoked to be owners? Maybe not. The maintenace fees are a joke. Do we love the Elara? YES.
reviews.title: Love this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You cant beat the location. Easy access to drive anywhere. The Miracle Mile shops are fantastic. The food nearby is great. The pool is great. The room was amazing. The security at elevator was annoying at times, but felt comforting. The whole place seemed "convenient".
reviews.title: ALL AROUND 5 STAR LUXURY STAY

reviews.text: We had a few very small glitches, which they quickly and politely fixed, and we would stay here again even if we were not owners.
reviews.title: Good quality & Friendly place

reviews.text: Stayed here 2/3/12 after a trip to new york decided to extend our stay to somewhere a little warmer.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally i booked Aria but the day before travelling changed it to Ph towers / Elara because i was advised there suites are nice. (Nice was not the right word)
reviews.title: Great Hotel by Planet Hollywood

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Planet Hollywood Towers. The huge projector TV is great and having the kitchenette and table was extremely useful. This is a great location, just off the strip.
reviews.title: Great price, great views

reviews.text: After reading mixed reviews on here I booked rooms at the Planet Hollywood Towers. Many people have complained about cleanliness, our room was spotless and the king size bed was very comfortable, besides if you go to Vegas to hang out in your room then you picked the wrong destination. The pull out did leave a little comfort to be desired but after walking around, drinking, and gambling all day you dont even notice it. Having a refigerator and glasses for shots/drinks was very nice. We got a free upgrade just for asking, I even tried to tip the clerck at check in $20 but she gave it back to me!!!! We put 4 and 5 people in the rooms and had plenty of room, we were basically asked at the desk how many keys we needed and were handed them with no problem. It is kind of annoying that you have to show your key to get on they elevators every time but it's not that big of a deal. I would recommend this to everyone!
reviews.title: Totally worth it!!!

reviews.text: On arrival approx 7pm on a Wednesday, we walked straight to the desk, where we were greeted by Carlos, very cheerful helpful and courteous. My husband explained that it was my birthday and our 1st Anniversary (it genuinely was), we had booked the 1 bedroomed suite, he had a look and got us an amazing room on the 28th floor, with fabulous views over towards, Paris, Bellagio fountains, Wynn and Encore. The suite had everything...immaculate, luxurious, accommodation. We spent 3 nights here, great access immediately from miracle Mile shops, which has lots of shops and eating places..Great location, central strip, has the perfect mix for a great stay...A special thank you to Carlos, who helped us sort out a problem we had with our cards and was extremeley professional!!! Would highly recommend PH Towers/Westgate!!!
reviews.title: Off the Planet!!! Will return!!

reviews.text: We booked several rooms at Planet Hollywood for a guys weekend in Las Vegas. The location of the hotel is great. It's a very nice property, but there are a few drawbacks. The rooms are sizable, but are showing some wear & tear (cracks, broken window blind, peeling, etc.). My shower head was damaged, sending water in every direction. Check-in & Check-out is average and there's usually a line...sometimes it's long. The casino is one of the loudest in Vegas. I also found it to be smokier than most of the newer casinos. Some or our group complained about their rooms being loud from the casino and/or street noise.
reviews.title: Some Good, Some Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really didn't appreciate some of the extra charges. They tried to charge me the $13.99 wireless fee twice for each day, since they charge it for "each device". So, if I use the wireless for my laptop and phone, I'm paying $27.98/day. Please! The $25/day fee for using the gym is very unfortunate, although I'm sure I could have researched that before travelling.
reviews.title: Ok, nothing special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a fabulous deal here through British Airways for a five night stay. Unusually for me, I had not checked the reviews before hand but did not worry as this is a Hilton Brand hotel. Then I read the reviews and got the fright of my life.....however....
reviews.title: Fantastic - must have stayed in a different hotel from some reviewers!

reviews.text: We arrived before official check-in time but were dealt with very quickly and professionally at the check-in desk and given our room immediately. This was on the 29th floor of the hotel and I LOVED IT!. Very bright and airy, fantastically comfortable bed, nice leather sofa for lounging, and really comfy chair for internet browsing or doing make-up etc.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The room has a small kitchen area with microwave, toaster, dis-washer, nice quality coffee is provided daily and the room is serviced to an exceptionally high standard - toileteries replenished etc.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Our room faced onto the back of the Paris Hotel, so we had a view of the Tower. You also get great views from the other side of the hotel when you come up in the lifts as they have huge big windows beside the elevators, which overlook part of the strip and the airport.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have stayed in

reviews.text: Everytime you enter the elevator area you have to show your room key-card to security - who were all very pleasant and professional. I found this very reassuring.
reviews.title: Not that bad

reviews.text: Place is a hole. Toilet leaked, shower not working. Got room changed, there was dirty underwear in the bathroom. Had a loud party across the hall, they tried to kick the door in. Called security, they did not come. Stayed her 12 months ago. It WAS good. Now it's just a run down stink hole. With Mexicans that can't clean to save them selves from deportation.
reviews.title: Terrible, be warned!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive: nice upgrade from studio suite to 2 bedroom condo. Pool nice. Great if just going for shopping and don't want to be connected to a casino. Just off strip but in middle so easy walking distance to many casinos. Minor issues: lightbulbs burned out, temperature regulation needs improvement.
reviews.title: Poor follow through and communication

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negative: unfortunate incident of having my purse stolen from my room while we slept. Poor follow through and communication from security. Security does not work weekends! WOW! No even superficial follow up or through to assure our safety. Did not even provide for me documentation to take to airport-I had no identity-it was all taken! Talked with two managers with no success or any changes.
reviews.title: One of the worst hotel experiences of our lives. Stay away!!!

reviews.text: Disappointing at best if you have any concerns with safety!
reviews.title: Terrible customer service

reviews.text: Wow....Where do I start. First I'd like to add a little credibility to my review by stating I've stayed at over ten Las Vegas hotels (all strip hotels minus the HR) and never once have I experienced such terrible service and ridiculous policies. I'm also a timeshare owner (thank god it's not Hilton) and have stayed at other vacation ownership properties. I strongly urge anyone considering a stay here to book elsewhere.
reviews.title: For the price it was very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed at Elara for the second time. On our first visit, and when we booked this trip, it was called PH Towers, but the ownership changed after we booked the trip. We got a great deal that included an upgrade to a suite--definitely the way to go! The room was enormous, with 5 TVs, a jacuzzi in the room, and a large kitchen. The hotel is located center-Strip (great for if you don't rent a car), very close to City Center, Bellagio, Paris/Ballys, Trop, and MGM. It's a short walk through the Miracle Mile shops to get to the Strip, which I actually prefer over having to navigate through a huge, smokey casino like you do at most hotels. These hotels (PH/Elara) cater to a younger crowd--seemed like most people here and in the casino were mid 20's-30's--and the restaurants/shopping were all more reasonably priced than other mid-Strip casinos like Aria and Bellagio. No trouble checking in early or checking out late, and excellent room service. We would definitely stay here again, especially if we get another good online deal.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, value, and location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Elara last week. New to the Hilton family, Elara gets 5 stars from me. Location is great connected to the Miracle Mile shops and walking distance from all the best on the strip (Bellagio, Paris, Aria, Ceasar's). The reveiws that say this is a long walk to the strip are not accurate in my opinion (unless 10 mintues is a long walk to you).
reviews.title: Best value for the money in Vegas!

reviews.text: I had a "basic room" which include a fridge and microwave and THE BEST view you will get from any hotel in Vegas at such a cheap rate. Typically, you have to pay for a decent view. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows on one entire wall. Just fabulous. The view alone was enough to give it 5 stars. And again, I was in a "basic room".
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Suite!

reviews.text: First off, if you are there for any sort of sporting event, you have got to get this suite. When we booked it, we didn't even know that it had a floor to ceiling projector screen.(I'll upload pics) We spent a Lot of time in our room because of this!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: The bedrooms were really cool. The beds were huge! One of the bedrooms had a couch that could fold out into a bed, and the other had a chaise that at least one of us crashed on at random times, and that bedroom had a giant jacuzzi in it too, as well as a washer/dryer in the bathroom.
reviews.title: top tower

aka: Planet Hollywood Towers Hotel Las Vegas
description: Ideally located in the heart of the most desirable location in Las Vegas, Elara, a Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel-Center Strip, provides an unrivaled resort setting. Towering over the center of the Las Vegas strip, the sleek 52-story tower is adjacent to the Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino complex and offers adjoining access to the 170+ shops and restaurants in the Miracle Mile. Just across the street, find the Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas and City Center to experience the best of Las Vegas. The hotel is also conveniently located to the I-15 freeway and only four miles from McCarran International Airport, Las Vegas Executive Air Terminal and Signature Flight Support.
